table.title: SoundWire Large System: 1 to 4-Load Daisy Chain Topology Notes

entry.p: To be placed on SNDW_CLK only, and maximum 10 mm from the connector.
This topology supports up to 4 devices where device placements are interchangable.
Max allowable cable length between nearest device and furthest device from CPU

[2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
[3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals
CPU TX & RX timing register configuration
Please refer to "Intel Smart Sound Technology ACPI Configuration" for further details on how to configure timing register. (BIOS Specification Doc#: 609917)
Device buffer driver strength & resistor combination
1) Device buffer driver strength of 20 Ω ± 30%
Refer to section on "Additional Guidelines - SoundWire* Interface Design Guidelines" for resistor placement to achieve the recommended device drive impedance target.
